
Let $Y_n = \phi Y_{n-1} + \epsilon_n$ for $n=1,2,\dots$ with $\epsilon_n \sim \mathrm{iid} N[0,\sigma^2]$ and $Y_0 = 0$.
The covariance of $Y_n$ with $Y_{n+k}$ for $k\ge 0$ is

A. $\sigma^2 \phi^k/(1-\phi^2)$

B. $\sigma^2 \phi^{2k}/(1-\phi^2)$

C. $\sigma^2 \phi^{k}/(1-\phi)$

D. $\sigma^2 \phi^{2k}/(1-\phi)$

E. None of the above.
